alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 25 at 3:58AM PST until February 28 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2000 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, except up to 8 inches in the high terrain. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, except up to 24 inches in the high terrain possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County. This includes Sawyers Bar Road, Etna Summit, and portions of Highway 3 and Highway 96. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 4 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Sunday night through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
